bibl.title: Letter from Harry J. Warthen to Philip Showalter Hench, November 8, 1951

div1.p: Warthen requests permission to borrow some of Reed's personal items for the next annual meeting of the Richmond Academy of Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Harry J. Warthen to Philip Showalter Hench, November 8, 1951
div1.opener:
RICHMOND ACADEMY OF MEDICINE
1200 EAST CLAY STREET
RICHMOND 19, VIRGINIA
November 8, 1951
Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The Richmond Academy of Medicine has an active and popular
Section devoted to the History of Medicine which meets annually
on “Walter Reed Night”. This well attended Section is dedi-
cated to the memory of Dr. Reed, in view of the fact that he
was a Virginian by birth and spent his most formative years in
this state.

We have just learned that you have a number of personal
momentoes of Dr. Reed. We usually have a display on the first
floor of our building for each Section Meeting and we wondered
if it would be possible to have some of these for an exhibit
at the next meeting in February. If this could be done it
would be most appropriate, as the observation of the centennial
of his birth will be included in the program of this meeting.

We of course would expect to underwrite any expenses in-
cident to shipping any material you may be good enough to let
us display. If you think well of this, I would like to go in-
to further details with you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Harry J. Warthen, M. D., Chairman,
